qas.question: Missionary work began in what Canadian colony?
When did missionary work begin in Canada?
What was the first Baptist church in Canada?
Where was the first Baptist church located in Canada?
When was the first Canadian Baptist church established?
Missionary work began in what American colony?
When did missionary work begin in America?
What was the first church of any kind in Canada?
Where was the first Anabaptist church located in Canada?
When was the first American Baptist church established?

context: Baptist missionary work in Canada began in the British colony of <a0_0><b5_0>Nova Scotia<b5_0/><a0_0/> (present day Nova Scotia and New Brunswick) in the <a1_0><b6_0>1760s<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The first official record of a Baptist church in Canada was that of the <a2_0><b7_0>Horton Baptist Church<b7_0/><a2_0/> (now Wolfville) in <a3_0><b8_0>Wolfville, Nova Scotia<b8_0/><a3_0/> on <a4_0><b9_0>29 October 1778<b9_0/><a4_0/>. The church was established with the assistance of the New Light evangelist Henry Alline. Many of Alline's followers, after his death, would convert and strengthen the Baptist presence in the Atlantic region.[page needed] Two major groups of Baptists formed the basis of the churches in the Maritimes. These were referred to as Regular Baptist (Calvinistic in their doctrine) and Free Will Baptists.
